identificationModule.briefTitle: Can Food Timing Reduce Your Diabetes Risk?
identificationModule.officialTitle: Can Food Timing Reduce Your Diabetes Risk?

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this clinical trial is to test whether food timing impacts metabolic health in healthy participants.

Participants will:

* complete 2 inpatient stays
* be provided with test meals
* have frequent blood draws
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The investigators aim to investigate the influence of different food timing, without changing 24-h caloric and nutrient intake, on glucose and fat tolerance and energy expenditure in healthy people on a simulated day or night shift.

armGroups.label: Day shift protocol with diet A
armGroups.description: Day shift protocol with diet A condition. Since this is a single-blind study, the details of the meal conditions cannot be released during the recruitment stage but will be made public once enrollment closes.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Day shift protocol - Diet order A-B
Behavioral: Day shift protocol - Diet order B-A

armGroups.label: Day shift protocol with diet B
armGroups.description: Day shift protocol with diet B condition. Since this is a single-blind study, the details of the meal conditions cannot be released during the recruitment stage but will be made public once enrollment closes.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Day shift protocol - Diet order A-B
Behavioral: Day shift protocol - Diet order B-A

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in glucose tolerance between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
primaryOutcomes.description: Glucose incremental area under the curve (AUC) from mixed meal tests

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in diet-induced thermogenesis between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
primaryOutcomes.description: Postprandial energy expenditure incremental area under the curve (AUC) from mixed meal tests

primaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in plasma triglyceride level between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
primaryOutcomes.description: Triglyceride area under the curve (AUC) over 24 hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in insulin sensitivity between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Insulin sensitivity index derived from Oral Minimal Model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in beta-cell function between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Beta-cell function index derived from Oral Minimal Model

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in 24-h glycemia between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Glucose area under the curve (AUC) based on CGM over 24 hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in postprandial incretin level between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Incretin incremental area under the curve (AUC) from mixed meal tests

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in substrate oxidation between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Postprandial substrate oxidation incremental area under the curve (AUC) from mixed meal tests

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Difference in plasma free fatty acids level between Meal Conditions and Shift Work
secondaryOutcomes.description: Free fatty acids area under the curve (AUC) over 24 hours

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy with no acute or chronic medical and psychiatric disorders
* BMI 25.0-34.9 kg/m2

Exclusion Criteria:

* Smokers, current tobacco or e-cigarette use
* Drug or alcohol dependency
* Pregnant
